channel.title: Need a good obfuscator
channel.description:
Anyone know of a good obfuscator for Java that is free or can be found free? ;)
I'm in dire need of one for a project I'm going to be working on. Also, feel free to delete this if it's in the wrong section, but I found it appropriate.

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

ada:

I use retroguard on my client, look it up with google

using open source obfuscator? honistly why use any obfuscator at all there is many other ways to protect your code and even with obfuscation bytecode is still accessible.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 06, 2006, 04:19:51 PM[/size][hr]Bytecode Obfuscation:

http://216.239.59.104/search?q=cache:YwEF5BuDSz4J:www.jproof.com/

they fucked there index.html

http://www.jproof.com

Read full topic

I use retroguard on my client, look it up with google

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

BobDole81:

Have your pick. http://mindprod.com/jgloss/obfuscator.html

thanks, theres a nice list of open-source ones here, good learning curve

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Sean:

As far as rs cheating goes I think all knowledge and source should be shared. We dont do this for a fucking job, I have a fucking job, this shit is for fun guys.

I agree with you to a point there.
The only reason we are obfuscating ARGA is to stop it from being abused. If we knew that people wouldn’t, then we’d gladly release it as open source. Sadly, as we saw happen to Aryan, it can’t really be stopped (short of triggering a mass ban <3)
Anyway, I figure that anyone who will benefit from seeing bot source, will be able to easily deobfuscate it anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Oh stop bitching and just make your own God damn obfuckskater if you care so much.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

jode sucks btw.

And yes, would I obfuscate my code? Depends entirely on my project. As far as rs cheating goes I think all knowledge and source should be shared. We dont do this for a fucking job, I have a fucking job, this shit is for fun guys. Chillax, no offence but none of you are coming up with anything innovative and in most cases havin other peope working on your code would benefit you alot. I know this is hypocritical I used to keep things to myself and I dont blame those who want to, im just at the stage where I have to ask why? Why is this application so special? Why not share it? Does this mean people should expect it ? No, I am one of the main people who went apeshit at the aryan community expecting things from us. I was a part of the development team, mainly design - they should be GRATEFUL of how we did it.

Show respect, gratitude and apprecation to those who do share.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

moparisthebest:

Oh and obfuscating is low down and dirty, open-source is the way to go

Meh, if all of it was MY code then I wouldn’t really worry too much about obfuscation. But when working in a group project with code that isn’t mine, I don’t want to release that to all.

Edit:

popcorn89:

I’m pretty sure there’s a download link for Zelix in the 3rd party programs.

Did a search on it. All I found was a bunch of broken links.

And to JODE, I DL’d it, and I’ll look through the description of the scripting once I have a chance.

Read full topic

item.title: Need a good obfuscator
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“popcorn89, post:6, topic:31206”][quote author=Sean link=topic=45511.msg556412#msg556412 date=1165053311]
obfuscation is fine, open sourcing your software is a personal choice.
[/quote]
Yeah, would you really expect JaGeX to release their client open-source? There are plenty of legitimate reasons for obfuscation…[/quote]
Yup, you aren’t going to sell software unobfuscated. That’s like saying:
‘Oh here you go. I worked on this for weeks. You can have the source, remove authentication and distribute it to all your friends, while my family and I starve.’

Read full topic
